info.name: From now we float
info.attribution:
Game implementation and layout by Mitchell Stolycia. Released under CC BY 4.0

All other art assets, including the library image were created by Mitchell Stolycia and are released under CC BY 4.0.
info.description: Antarctica gone. The planet flooded. From now we float.
info.ruleText:
This implementation includes 15 playable factions, including 3 of the promotional factions.
This section does not outline the entirety of the game, only a reminder of the value x, and the faction abilities.

Value x
Value x represents the party size, i.e. the number of cards played in a party.

Faction abilities

A:
Take an A token (star-shaped) from the supply up to value x. Whoever has the highest sum at the end of the round will be favoured in a tie in any region they are present.
If players are still tied, on both region influence, and A sum values, they split the points for their both their positions. i.e. If two players tie for first, split the points for first and second, if available.
Example: If Josh played 3 cards with an A leader, he could take the A 3 token from the supply. If Susan already had the A 3 token in front of her, Josh would have to take either the A 2 or A 1 token instead, if available.
B:
If the played party is now the largest B party, place the B token on this holder after pressing End turn. Score 4 VP immediately.
The player who has control of this token at the end of the round scores points as if it was a region.

C:
One fewer card is needed to increase influence in an area.
Example: Susan may play a C lead party with only 2 cards to place gain her 3rd influence in a region.
D:
Click on the region which matches the colour you played to this turn. For each black slot at the end of a round, you may empty the slots by clicking on them to score points according to the D board. If you do not empty them between rounds, they do not score, but may be emptied next round and scored instead.

E:
Keep up to x cards in hand.
Example: Willie plays an E lead party of size 4. He may keep up to 4 cards that he still has in his hand. The rest must be returned to the display.
When keeping some cards in hand with this ability, manually drag any cards to the display that you are not keeping in hand.

F:
Draw x cards from the deck (not the display), after discarding your hand.
This will be done automatically when you end your turn.
If any clock cards are drawn, manually drag any cards you're owed from the Draw deck.

G:
If influence was increased in an area this turn, you may play another party before discarding, regardless of the following leader or colour.
This second leader is also activated, even if it is another G leader.
Play all the sets you would like to use at the same time before ending you turn when using this ability. Do not manually adjust influence.

H:
At round end, each party with an H leader scores as if it contains an extra card.
Example: Fanny has played a size 4 party with an H leader. At the end of the round, this will score 10 VP for party size as opposed to the usual 6.

I:
Put the lowest value I marker from the supply in the matching region.
These markers add value to first place scoring this round.
They are returned to the supply at the end of a round.

J:
Manually move your square up the J board x spaces. If you reach or cross a +1 influence anywhere space, increase your influence in any region.
Players score the J board according to the table as if it's a region.
Squares on the J board never reset.

The O board can be moved by dragging it.

K:
Gain one influence in any one region, instead of just the matching colour. The party must still be large enough to influence following normal rules.
Do this by manually clicking on the right hand side of the desired influence marker (coloured square).

L:
L cards cannot be leaders. L cards can be played as party of any party, regardless of colour or faction.
They count towards increasing influence in a region, but not towards party size at the end of a round. This will be noted on your holders by a number and an L in brackets, after your cards have been cleared.
Example: Jezebel has played a J leader with a party size of 5, with 2 L cards presents. When she clicks 'End turn', her cards are cleared, leaving her with a holder that reads "5J (2L)".
At the end of the round Jezebel will score 3 VP for the size of this party.
M:
If an M card is played as a leader, you will not gain influence in that region. There are twice as many M cards in the deck.
Using an M card in a party with a different leader acts the same as all other cards.

N:
After ending your turn and discarding your hand to the display, x cards will be moved from the deck to the display. After this, you may take any 2 cards from the display.
Any parties with N leaders at the end of a round will score as if they have one fewer card.
Example: Josh has 5 cards in hand before playing a party of 3 with an N leader. After doing so, Josh discards returns the other two cards to the display, and 3 cards are moved from the deck to the display. Josh then decides to draw one card that he returned to the display, and one other card from the display to his hand.
Implementation note: When drawing these two cards from the display, drag them to your hand. Otherwise - or alternatively - you may cycle through players' turns with the Force next turn button.
O:
Manually move your square up the O board x spaces. If you reach or cross spaces 3, 7, 12, 15, or 18, you may move influence from one region to either an adjacent or any region, depending on the space on the O board
Players score the O board according to the table as if it's a region.
Squares on the O board never reset.

The O board can be moved by dragging it.
info.helpText:
To start:
  1. All players sit down by clicking on a seat each.
  2. Click the Prepare for new game button.
  3. This will take you to a menu where you can choose which factions you would like to be in play.
  4. If random factions are not chosen, click Setup when you are happy with your selected factions placed in the appropriate holders.
Drawing a card:
  • Click on a card - or the deck - to draw. This will also end your turn.
    • If drawing via the F faction ability, these will be added to your hand automatically. If any clock cards are drawn, manually drag any cards you're owed from the Draw deck.
Playing a party:
  • Drag the cards you wish to play to one of your eight designated player holders.
  • Make sure your desired leader is on top of the party.
  • Click End Turn. This will automatically increase your influence in the lead region colour, if possible.
    • This also accounts for faction ability C.
    • If playing a K leader, manually adjust your influence in a region by clicking on the right hand side of your influence marker (coloured square).
  • In the unlikely event that you run out of space, and have filled all eight of your holders, it is recommended you play cards to a holder with value 1 on it, as these score no points at the end of a round for party size.
    • Do not overwrite any previously played H leaders in this way.
Increasing influence:
  • In most cases, influence will increase automatically in the played regions.
  • To manually increase/decrease your influence, click on the right/left hand side of your influence marker (coloured square).
Discarding your hand:
  • Your hand will be discarded automatically if End turn is clicked.
    • If an E leader has been used, this will not occur. Drag any discarded cards to the display instead.
Scoring VP:
  • To keep track of points throughout the game, use the counters next to the seats to manually adjust scores.
Next round:
  • Click the Next round button.
    • A tokens will be returned to the supply automatically.
The Force next turn button will cycle to the next player turn. Due to the speed of player turns, it can be easy to accidentally skip someone's turn. Use this button only to cycle to the correct player. This should not be necessary, but is present to help with correcting misplays.

thenRoutine.note: CONTINUE HERE. THIS IS WHERE YOU LABEL THE BOARD

fields.text: Are you sure you want to erase any progress and start a new game?

setupClick0Routine.header: Would you like the factions in play to be random?

fields.text: If not, you will be taken to a second game state before setup commences, whereby you can choose which factions you want in play. If you want the basic setup recommended for beginners, also click No.

setupClick0Routine: var words = 'A_p,B_p,C_p,D_p,E_p,F_p,G_p,H_p,I_p,J_p,K_p,l,M_p,N_p,O_p' split ',' //Split the list of words into an array using commas as a split point

fields.text: Are you sure you want to start a new round?

clickRoutine.note: here on is to determine first player of 2nd round
